messages.message:
Hey team, wondering if anyone knows how to fix this, I canâ€™t load any files on localhost and when I run `ppy logs grpc-file-service` I get these errors that seem to be about a credential issue?
```2022/11/15 23:51:22 WARNING fileservice/clients/s3_client.go:166 -- Default AWS URL provided, using URL with region: https://s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com
2022/11/15 23:51:22 INFO fileservice/handler/file.go:277 -- [connect] Username: danny.lan, Path: danny.lan/practice-flow/fs/Instabase Drive, Time: 60ms, Size: 0Bytes
2022/11/15 23:51:27 ERROR fileservice/clients/s3_client.go:354 -- Failure during stat. Path: 78e42e78-d07d-4ba4-9678-c41c17efe2e5 Err: operation error S3: HeadObject, failed to sign request: failed to retrieve credentials: failed to refresh cached credentials, no EC2 IMDS role found, operation error ec2imds: GetMetadata, request canceled, context deadline exceeded
2022/11/15 23:51:27 ERROR fileservice/handler/file.go:279 -- [ERROR][list_dir] Username: danny.lan, Path: danny.lan/practice-flow/fs/Instabase Drive, Err: rpc error: code = Internal desc = Failure during stat., Time: 5073ms, Size: 0Bytes
2022/11/15 23:51:27 INFO fileservice/handler/file.go:277 -- [connect] Username: danny.lan, Path: danny.lan/practice-flow/fs/Instabase Drive, Time: 2ms, Size: 0Bytes
2022/11/15 23:52:23 ERROR fileservice/clients/s3_client.go:354 -- Failure during stat. Path: 78e42e78-d07d-4ba4-9678-c41c17efe2e5 Err: operation error S3: HeadObject, exceeded maximum number of attempts, 6, failed to sign request: failed to retrieve credentials: failed to refresh cached credentials, no EC2 IMDS role found, operation error ec2imds: GetMetadata, exceeded maximum number of attempts, 3, request send failed, Get "http://169.254.169.254/latest/meta-data/iam/security-credentials/": dial tcp 169.254.169.254:80: i/o timeout
2022/11/15 23:52:23 ERROR fileservice/handler/file.go:279 -- [ERROR][list_dir] Username: danny.lan, Path: danny.lan/practice-flow/fs/Instabase Drive, Err: rpc error: code = Internal desc = Failure during stat., Time: 55504ms, Size: 0Bytes```
Can you check if you have your aws credentials setup correctly on your local machine? Try going through the onboarding setup for aws again.
it seems like I have access to s3, I can see files after running `aws s3 ls test.data.instabase.com/tests/ (http://test.data.instabase.com/tests/)`
